III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
Description ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date in June 2024, a foster care worker gave
youth permission to hit another foster youth if their possessions
came up missing.
Investigation The Program Manager was interviewed on 7/10/2024. She
reported Foster Care Worker (FCW) works for Vista Maria, and
she is the case worker for Foster Child A and Foster Child C who
is placed in the home of Foster Parent. She reported allegedly
Foster Care Worker told Foster Child B if something comes up
missing from her belongings, that Foster Child B has her full
permission to hit Foster Child A. This was in reference to Foster
Child B hitting Foster Child A for stealing Foster Child B’s
belongings. It is noted that Foster Child C is also placed in the
home of Foster Parent.
It is also noted that Foster Child A and Foster Child C are siblings
placed in the foster home. Foster Care Worker is not the Foster
Care Worker for Foster Care B.
The Program Manager reported this incident allegedly occurred
sometime in June 2024. She said upon learning of this allegation
from the Foster Care Supervisor who was onsite (foster home) at
the time to conduct an interview from the foster care youths
regarding another investigation, Foster Care Worker came to the
foster parent home unannounced. Program Manager said Foster
Care Supervisor 1 contacted her (Program Manager) and
informed her that Foster Care Worker was at the Foster Parent’s
home. The Program Manager said prior, Foster Care Worker
was informed and instructed twice by Program Manager and
Director to not go to the foster home due to an allegation that was
involving Foster Care worker and Foster Child A and Foster Child
C in the home. Program Manager said Foster Care Worker was
2

notified also by centralized intake that there was a complaint that
involved her (Foster Care Worker) and two of the youths in the
foster home. Program Manager said Foster Care Worker went to
the foster home knowing there was a pending investigation
involving Foster Care Worker.
Program Manager reported agency staff, which included two
foster care supervisors, went to Foster Parent home to interview
the foster children and Foster Parent about the allegation.
However, when the two foster care supervisors arrived at the
foster home, Foster Care Worker arrived to the home
unannounced. Foster Care Supervisor 1 informed Foster Care
Worker she had to leave the premises as the allegations involving
Foster Care Worker were being investigated by the two foster care
supervisors that were on site.
Foster Care Supervisor 1 (FCS 1) was interviewed on
7/12/2024. She reported the same information as the
Complainant. She added that she called the agency and reported
Foster Care Worker had arrived at the foster home unannounced.
She said she called FC Director of the agency who spoke with
Foster Care Worker and allegedly, the Director asked Foster Care
Worker, why she was at the foster home. According to FCS 1,
Foster Care Worker told the Director that she wants to clear her
name. She said Director told Foster Care Worker to leave the
foster home immediately.
FCS 1 reported she interviewed Foster Parent. She said Foster
Parent informed her when the foster children have meetings with
their workers, she goes to another room or to the kitchen to cook.
FCS 1 said Foster Parent is extremely supportive of the Foster
Care Worker assigned to Foster Child A and Foster Child C. FCS
1 said Foster Parent stated several times how great of a worker
Foster Care Worker is and how Foster Care Worker is always
there to support and provide resources for Foster Children A and
C.
FCS 1 reported she interviewed each of the foster children placed
in the home of Foster Parent regarding the allegation. She said
Foster Child B reported she was not given permission or a
directive to hit Foster Child A. She said when she interviewed
Foster Child C, Foster Child C denied hearing Foster Care Worker
giving Foster Child B permission to hit Foster Child A. FCS 1
reported when she interviewed Foster Child A, Foster Child A
stated she could not remember the exact date in June, but she
was in the bedroom with Foster Child B when her worker, (Foster
3

Care Worker) came to the bedroom to see Foster Child A. She
said Foster Child B reported to Foster Care worker that Foster
Child A was stealing her belongings. FCS 1 said Foster Child A
held firm to her story and stated Foster Care Worker told Foster
Child B if something else comes up missing that Foster Child B
had Foster Care Worker’s permission to hit Foster Child A. FCS 1
said Foster Child A told her mother what Foster Care Worker said.
FCS 1 said she interviewed the Foster Care Worker and Foster
Care Worker denied the allegation.
Foster Care Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 7/12/2024. She
did not add any additional information.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 7/12/2024 and
8/20/2024 via telephone. She reported she was aware of why
she was contacted. She said she wanted to go on record that she
never told Foster Child B to hit Foster Child A. She reported she
had been working for Vista Maria for two years and she has been
professional the entire time of working with her “clients.” She said
the only involvement she has ever had with Foster Child B was to
say hello to her and other than this, she has no other interactions
with Foster Child B. She said when she heard the allegation, she
became very upset and went to the foster home to address the
allegation with the youths and to clear her name because she was
resigning from the agency due to employment elsewhere and she
did not want this allegation to follow her to her new employment.
FCW said her last day of working at Vista Maria was 7/15/2024.
FCW said she did not want her name “trashed” and she would
never encourage “one kid to hit another kid.” She reported she
did not know she was not allowed to go to the foster home, and
she went there to clear her name and to say good bye to her two
clients (Foster Child A and C) in the home because she was
resigning from the agency and would not be working with them
anymore. FCW said she was resigning because she had found
employment with another organization with better benefits.
Foster Parent was interviewed on 8/14/2024, via telephone.
She reported she did not hear Foster Care Worker tell Foster
Child B to hit Foster Child A. She reported she has no issues with
the foster children place in her home and no issues with the FCW.
The Foster Parent said she never witness the FCW talking with
Foster Child B.
4

Foster Child A was interviewed on 8/14/2024, via telephone.
She reported Foster Care Worker did tell Foster Child B to hit her
if she steals any of her belongings. She said Foster Child B has
never hit her. Foster Child A said she does not remember the
exact date of this, but it was in June when Foster Care Worker
came out to the foster home for her monthly visits with Foster
Child A and Foster Child C. She reported she has never stolen
anything from Foster Child B and Foster Child B has never hit her.
Foster Child B was interviewed on 8/14/2024, via telephone.
She reported Foster Care Worker has never told her or given her
instructions to hit Foster Child A. She said she is much older
than Foster Child A and she would never hit her. She had no
additional information.
Foster Child C was interviewed on 8/14/2024, via telephone.
He reported he never heard Foster Care Worker tell Foster Child
B to hit Foster Child A. He said his room is in close proximity to
Foster Child A and Foster Child B’s bedroom and sometimes he
can hear their conversation especially when the Foster Care
Worker comes out to visit.
Documents Reviewed:
• Foster Care Worker personnel file. Personnel file indicated
Foster Care Worker was employed with Vista Maria from
5/2/2022 – 7/15/2024. FCW had one previous disciplinary
action, a verbal warning documented in her file on
10/17/2023, due to her behavior on camera at a Team
Decision Meeting. A complaint was filed against Foster
Care Worker regarding some comments she made towards
the facilitator.
• MiSACWIS history of Foster Child A, B and C.
Foster Child A – Placed in the current foster home on
8/31/2023.
Foster Child B - Placed in the current foster home on
6/13/2023.
Foster Child C - Placed in the current foster home on
8/31/2023.
• Special Investigation #2024SEC0001737 with an intake
date of 7/9/2024 between Foster Child C and the Foster
Parent. Violation of Rule 400.9413 (1) Supervision was not
established.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
evidence to support the allegation. Foster Child A did disclose the
5

allegation occurred, however Foster Care Worker and Foster
Child B both denied the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
